headline.main: Earnhardt to Match Career High With 34rd Start at Michigan
headline.print_headline: Earnhardt to Match Career High With 34rd Start at Michigan

docs.snippet: Dale Earnhardt Jr. slipped through sliding doors of his hauler, and parted into a sea of memorabilia-toting fans....
docs.lead_paragraph: Dale Earnhardt Jr. slipped through sliding doors of his hauler, and parted into a sea of memorabilia-toting fans.

headline.main: UN Honored Ali's Lifelong Commitment to Peace and Rights
headline.print_headline: UN Honored Ali's Lifelong Commitment to Peace and Rights

docs.snippet: When Muhammad Ali was trying to win a fourth heavyweight championship in the late 1970s, he came to the United Nations to campaign against apartheid and injustice and presented then secretary-general Kurt Waldheim with one of his drawings entitled...
docs.lead_paragraph: When Muhammad Ali was trying to win a fourth heavyweight championship in the late 1970s, he came to the United Nations to campaign against apartheid and injustice and presented then secretary-general Kurt Waldheim with one of his drawings entitled "Peace!"

headline.main: Police: St. Louis-Area Woman Drowned 2 Kids, Set Fatal Fire
headline.print_headline: Police: St. Louis-Area Woman Drowned 2 Kids, Set Fatal Fire

docs.snippet: Police in a St. Louis suburb said Saturday that they believe a 37-year-old woman drowned her two children in a bathtub before dying in a house fire that she appeared to set intentionally....
docs.lead_paragraph: Police in a St. Louis suburb said Saturday that they believe a 37-year-old woman drowned her two children in a bathtub before dying in a house fire that she appeared to set intentionally.

headline.main: Soccer Teams Raise the Curtain on the Live Show in Stadium Tunnels
headline.print_headline: Soccer Focuses on a Side Show

docs.snippet: In the top echelon of soccer, the stadium tunnels — and what happens there — have become a big part of the televised spectacle....
docs.abstract: High-level soccer allows television cameras inside stadium tunnels and other areas that were once private, giving viewers candid look at players and officials before games.

byline.contributor: Andrew Das contributed reporting from New York.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the top echelon of soccer, the stadium tunnels — and what happens there — have become a big part of the televised spectacle.

headline.main: Pirates Put C Cervelli on DL With Broken Hand, Get C Kratz
headline.print_headline: Pirates Put C Cervelli on DL With Broken Hand, Get C Kratz

docs.snippet: The Pittsburgh Pirates put catcher Francisco Cervelli on the 15-day disabled list Saturday with a broken left hand that is expected to sideline him four to six weeks....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Pittsburgh Pirates put catcher Francisco Cervelli on the 15-day disabled list Saturday with a broken left hand that is expected to sideline him four to six weeks.

headline.main: Funeral Held for Soldier Killed in Training Accident

headline.main: Britain and Ireland Takes 8-4 Lead in Curtis Cup
headline.print_headline: Britain and Ireland Takes 8-4 Lead in Curtis Cup

docs.snippet: England's Bronte Law won two more matches and Britain and Ireland took all but one point Saturday to open an 8-4 lead in the Curtis Cup, leaving the Americans behind entering the closing singles session for the first time in two decades....
docs.lead_paragraph: England's Bronte Law won two more matches and Britain and Ireland took all but one point Saturday to open an 8-4 lead in the Curtis Cup, leaving the Americans behind entering the closing singles session for the first time in two decades.

headline.main: Violence Mars England's 1-1 Draw With Russia at Euro 2016
headline.print_headline: Violence Mars England's 1-1 Draw With Russia at Euro 2016

docs.snippet: Russia fans stormed a section of England supporters inside the stadium moments after Saturday's 1-1 draw between the countries at the European Championship on another day of violence and rioting in the southern French city of Marseille....
docs.lead_paragraph: Russia fans stormed a section of England supporters inside the stadium moments after Saturday's 1-1 draw between the countries at the European Championship on another day of violence and rioting in the southern French city of Marseille.

headline.main: Citgo Aruba to Invest $450M to $650M to Reopen Idle Refinery
headline.print_headline: Citgo Aruba to Invest $450M to $650M to Reopen Idle Refinery

docs.snippet: Citgo Aruba announced Saturday it will invest $450 million to $650 million to reactivate an oil refinery in Aruba that has been idle since 2012....
docs.lead_paragraph: Citgo Aruba announced Saturday it will invest $450 million to $650 million to reactivate an oil refinery in Aruba that has been idle since 2012.
